intro: Reynosia excisa, commonly known as the California buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to coastal areas of California and Baja California. It features compound leaves with serrated edges, typically ranging from 10 to 20 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by dark blue, fleshy berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats. Reynosia excisa is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and coastal winds.
